section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: CategoryAVessel
def.leadIn: Category A vessel (A類船隻) means a local vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a class and type specified in columns 1 and 2 of Schedule 1 to the Survey Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: categorized as a Category A vessel in column 3 of that Schedule;

def.name: CategoryBVessel
def.leadIn: Category B vessel (B類船隻) means a local vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a class and type specified in columns 1 and 2 of Schedule 1 to the Survey Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: categorized as a Category B vessel in column 3 of that Schedule;

subsection.def: certificate of inspection (檢查證明書) means a certificate of inspection issued under section 19(2) of the Survey Regulation;
certificate of survey (驗船證明書) means a certificate of survey issued under section 24(1) of the Survey Regulation;
Certification and Licensing Regulation (《證明書及牌照規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D);
class (類別), in relation to a local vessel, means a class of local vessel specified in column 1 of Schedule 1 to the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
classification society (船級社) means an organization approved under section 8 of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369);
declaration of fitness (適合運載危險品聲明) means a declaration of fitness for the carriage of dangerous goods issued under section 54 or 65(4) of the Survey Regulation;

extreme breadth (最大寬度), in relation to a local vessel, means the athwartship distance between the extremity of the outermost permanent structure on the port side and the extremity of the outermost permanent structure on the starboard side of the vessel;
Ferry Terminals Regulation (《渡輪終點碼頭規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Ferry Terminals) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. B);
freeboard assignment certificate (乾舷勘定證明書) means a freeboard assignment certificate issued under section 46 or 65(4) of the Survey Regulation;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a full licence issued under section 15 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation or renewed under section 17 of that Regulation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full licence issued, endorsed or renewed under section 23 or 26 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation (including, in the case of section 23 of that Regulation, that section as applied by section 29 of that Regulation);

subsection.def: General Regulation (《一般規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. F);
gross tonnage (總噸位), in relation to a local vessel, means the gross tonnage specified in the certificate of ownership issued in respect of the vessel;
Hong Kong load line certificate (香港載重線證明書) means a Hong Kong load line certificate issued under section 46 or 65(4) of the Survey Regulation;

def.name: MonthlyPeriod
def.leadIn: monthly period (一個月期間) means a period beginning on a day in a calendar month and ending on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day before the corresponding day in the following calendar month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the period begins on a day that is the last day of a calendar month, the day before the last day of the following calendar month;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the period begins on 30 January in a leap year, the next following 28 February; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the period begins on 29 or 30 January in any year other than a leap year, the next following 27 February;

subsection.def: net tonnage (淨噸位), in relation to a local vessel, means the net tonnage specified in the certificate of ownership issued in respect of the vessel;
office hours (辦公時間) means the hours between 8:30 a.m. and 5:45 p.m. on Monday to Friday, excluding general holidays;

permission for a laid-up vessel (閑置船隻允許書) means the written permission granted under section 66 of the Ordinance for a laid-up vessel to be berthed, moored or anchored at any place in the waters of Hong Kong, including such permission that is endorsed or granted under section 23 or 26 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation (including, in the case of section 23 of that Regulation, that section as applied by section 29 of that Regulation);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public officer to whom the Director has delegated any of his functions or powers under section 72 of the Ordinance;

subsection.def: survey record of safety equipment (安全設備檢驗紀錄) means a survey record of safety equipment issued under section 39 or 65(4) of the Survey Regulation;
Survey Regulation (《檢驗規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. G);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a temporary licence issued or renewed under section 19 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a temporary licence issued, endorsed or renewed under section 23 or 26 of that Regulation (including, in the case of section 23 of that Regulation, that section as applied by section 29 of that Regulation);

subsection.def: type (類型), in relation to a local vessel, means a type of local vessel specified in column 2 of Schedule 1 to the Certification and Licensing Regulation;
Typhoon Shelters Regulation (《避風塘規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Typhoon Shelters) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. E);

def.name: YearlyPeriod
def.leadIn: yearly period (一年期間) means a period beginning on a day in a calendar year and ending on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day before the corresponding day in the following calendar year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the period begins on 29 February in a leap year, 27 February in the following calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, except where otherwise specially provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a local vessel of any class and of any type is a reference to a local vessel certificated for that class and for that type in accordance with section 4 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a Class I, II, III or IV vessel is a reference to a local vessel certificated for Class I, II, III or IV respectively under the Certification and Licensing Regulation.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Ferry Terminals) Regulation

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fees for application for issue of passes, issue of replacement passes and berthing

subsection.content: The fee to be paid in respect of an application under section 13 of the Ferry Terminals Regulation for the issue of a standard pass by a person who is not an authorized officer is $105.
The fee to be paid in respect of the issue of a replacement pass under section 24 of the Ferry Terminals Regulation is $180.

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid under section 28 of the Ferry Terminals Regulation for berthing in respect of a local vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $3 per unit of the chargeable net tonnage of the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means an authorized officer within the meaning of section 2 of the Ferry Terminals Regulation;

def.name: ChargeableNetTonnage
def.leadIn: chargeable net tonnage (須予繳費淨噸位), in relation to a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the net tonnage of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that net tonnage is not a whole number, the net tonnage rounded up to the next whole number;

subsection.def: ferry vessel (渡輪船隻) means a ferry vessel within the meaning of section 2 of the Ferry Terminals Regulation.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees for application for issue or renewal of full licences or temporary licences

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the fee to be paid in respect of an application under section 15, 17 or 19 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation for the issue or renewal of a full licence, or a temporary licence, in respect of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a licence valid for a period of 12 months, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a licence valid for a period of less than 12 months, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the validity period—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the monthly period beginning on the first day of the validity period;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

subparagraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each day within the validity period that does not fall within a monthly period referred to in subparagraph (i), an amount equal to 1/365 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel.

subsection.leadIn: If the licence is issued or renewed in respect of a Class IV vessel and permits the vessel to carry more than 14 persons, there shall be payable in respect of the application an additional fee of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a licence valid for a period of 12 months, the amount specified in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a licence valid for a period of less than 12 months, an amount equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the validity period—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the monthly period beginning on the first day of the validity period;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

subparagraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the amount specified in subsection (4);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each day within the validity period that does not fall within a monthly period referred to in subparagraph (i), an amount equal to 1/365 of the amount specified in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: If the licence is issued or renewed in respect of a floating restaurant, or a stationary vessel that is certificated as a Class I vessel, there shall be payable in respect of the application an additional fee of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a licence valid for a period of 12 months, the amount specified in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a licence valid for a period of less than 12 months, an amount equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the validity period—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the monthly period beginning on the first day of the validity period;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

subparagraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the amount specified in subsection (5);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each day within the validity period that does not fall within a monthly period referred to in subparagraph (i), an amount equal to 1/365 of the amount specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The amount specified for the purposes of subsection (2) is the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first 15 persons that the vessel concerned is permitted to carry, $165;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each additional person that the vessel concerned is permitted to carry, $165.

subsection.content: The amount specified for the purposes of subsection (3) is, for each person that the vessel concerned is permitted to carry, $165.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Fees for application for grant of permission for laid-up vessel
section.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of an application under section 21 of the Certification and Licensing Regulation for the grant of permission for a laid-up vessel in respect of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a permission for the vessel to be berthed, moored or anchored at any place in the waters of Hong Kong for a period of less than 12 months, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the permission period—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the monthly period beginning on the first day of the permission period;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

subparagraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a permission for the vessel to be berthed, moored or anchored at any place in the waters of Hong Kong for a period of more than 12 months, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the permission period—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the yearly period beginning on the first day of the permission period;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent yearly period,

subparagraph.continued: the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the permission period—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

subparagraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: for each day within the permission period that does not fall within subparagraph (i) or (ii), an amount equal to 1/365 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Fees for termination of suspension of certificates of survey and licences

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of terminating the suspension of a certificate of survey, and a full licence or temporary licence, under section 33(5) of the Certification and Licensing Regulation after a re-inspection by a relevant surveyor of the local vessel concerned is a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first hour of the service period of each relevant surveyor for the re-inspection, $3,270;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each subsequent hour of the service period of each of such relevant surveyor for the re-inspection, $1,115.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship inspector within the meaning of section 33(7) of the Certification and Licensing Regulation;

def.name: ServicePeriod
def.leadIn: service period (服務期間), in relation to a re-inspection carried out by a relevant surveyor of a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the re-inspection continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fees for certain matters under Certification and Licensing Regulation

subsection.content: The fee to be paid in respect of a matter described in column 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 is the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the matter.

The Director may waive the fee to be paid in respect of the issue of a duplicate of a certificate of ownership, full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel under section 54(1) of the Certification and Licensing Regulation if he is satisfied that the original of the certificate, licence or permission has been destroyed, defaced or lost through fire or shipwreck.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation

section.name: s8
section.heading: Fees for certain matters under General Regulation
section.content: The fee to be paid in respect of a matter described in column 2 of Schedule 2 is the fee specified in column 3 of that Schedule opposite the matter.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Purposes of Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Safety and Survey) Regulation

section.name: s9
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: ConsiderationPeriod
def.leadIn: consideration period (考慮期間), in relation to the consideration of plans by a specified officer, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the consideration continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number;

def.name: ServicePeriod
def.leadIn: service period (服務期間), in relation to a survey or re-inspection carried out by a specified officer, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the survey or re-inspection continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number;

subsection.def: travel period (出差期間), in relation to a survey or re-inspection carried out by a specified officer, means the period of time during which the officer is outside Hong Kong on account of the survey or re-inspection.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of travel period, a specified officer is outside Hong Kong from the moment when he departs from Hong Kong to the moment when he arrives at Hong Kong.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Fees for consideration of plans under Part 3 of Survey Regulation

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid under sections 8(4)(e) and 11(3) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for approval, for the purposes of section 9(1) of that Regulation, of plans relating to a specified vessel, $1,115 for each hour of the consideration period of a specified officer for considering the plans;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for approval, for the purposes of section 9(1), (2) or (3) of that Regulation, of relevant plans relating to a non-specified vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 3, the fee specified in column 4 of that Part opposite the description of the plans;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for approval, for the purposes of section 9(4) of that Regulation, of plans relating to a non-specified vessel, $3,600.

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid under section 14(3) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the plans relating to a specified vessel are considered for the purposes of section 9(1) of that Regulation, $1,115 for each hour of the consideration period of a specified officer for considering the plans;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the relevant plans relating to a non-specified vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 3 are considered for the purposes of section 9(1), (2) or (3) of that Regulation, the fee specified in column 4 of that Part opposite the description of the plans;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case where the plans relating to a non-specified vessel are considered for the purposes of section 9(4) of that Regulation, $3,600.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: non-specified vessel (非指明船隻) means a local vessel that is not a specified vessel;
relevant plan (有關圖則), in relation to a non-specified vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 3, means a plan described in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;
specified vessel (指明船隻) means a Class IV vessel that falls within section 7(3)(b) or (ba) of the Survey Regulation. (L.N. 71 of 2020)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Fees for consideration of plans: alteration to local vessels

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(i) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the consideration of plans and, as the case may be, the approval of plans relating to a local vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the plans are considered in relation to a permission to make an alteration to a local vessel to an extent that will render the particulars stated in a certificate of inspection in force in respect of the vessel inaccurate, $1,115 for each hour of the consideration period of a specified officer for considering the plans;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the plans are considered in relation to a permission to make an alteration to a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 3 to an extent that will render the particulars specified in subsection (2) inaccurate, 1/10 of the fee specified in column 4 of that Part opposite the description of the relevant plans relating to the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case where the plans are considered in relation to a permission to make an alteration to a local vessel to an extent that will render the particulars stated in a declaration of fitness in force in respect of the vessel inaccurate, $1,200.

subsection.content: The particulars specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are those stated in a certificate of survey, survey record of safety equipment, Hong Kong load line certificate, or freeboard assignment certificate in force in respect of the local vessel concerned.

subsection.def: In this section, relevant plan (有關圖則), in relation to a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 3, means a plan described in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Fees for surveys for issue of certificates of survey and certificates of inspection

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 16 and 17, the fee to be paid under section 17(4)(b) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a certificate of survey valid for not more than 3 months, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, 1/2 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/8 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a certificate of survey valid for more than 3 months, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/4 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a certificate of survey, of a floating dock that is not classed with a classification society is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first hour of the service period of each specified officer for the survey, $3,270; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent hour of the service period of each specified officer for the survey, $1,115;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a certificate of inspection, of a Class IV vessel that falls within section 15(2)(b) or (ba) of the Survey Regulation— (L.N. 71 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, $2,200; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, $550.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), each visit by each specified officer to a local vessel for the purposes of a survey is counted as one relevant visit to the vessel for the survey.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Fees for surveys for issue of survey records of safety equipment, Hong Kong load line certificates, freeboard assignment certificates and declarations of fitness

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 16 and 17, the fee to be paid under section 57(1) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a survey record of safety equipment, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 4 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where the survey record is valid for not more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, 1/2 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/8 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the survey record is valid for more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/4 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a Hong Kong load line certificate, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 5 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where the certificate is valid for not more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, 1/2 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/8 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the certificate is valid for more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/4 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a freeboard assignment certificate, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 6 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where the certificate is valid for not more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, 1/2 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/8 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the certificate is valid for more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/4 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for survey, for the purposes of the issue of a declaration of fitness, of a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Part 7 of Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where the declaration of fitness is valid for not more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, 1/2 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/8 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where the declaration of fitness is valid for more than 3 months—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the first 3 relevant visits to the vessel for the survey, the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent relevant visit to the vessel for the survey, 1/4 of the fee specified in column 3 of that Part opposite the type of vessel.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), each visit by each specified officer to a local vessel for the purposes of a survey is counted as one relevant visit to the vessel for the survey.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Fees for surveys: alteration to local vessels
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 16 and 17, the fee, under section 76(5)(d)(ii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of a survey of a local vessel by a specified officer is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first hour of the service period of each officer for the survey, $3,270; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each subsequent hour of the service period of each officer for the survey, $1,115.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Fees for re-inspections under Survey Regulation
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 16 and 17, the fee to be paid under section 21(3), 26(3) or 65(3) of the Survey Regulation for the re-inspection of a local vessel by a specified officer is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first hour of the service period of each officer for the re-inspection, $3,270; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each subsequent hour of the service period of each officer for the re-inspection, $1,115.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Additional fees for surveys or re-inspections outside Hong Kong
section.leadIn: If the survey referred to in section 12, 13 or 14, or the re-inspection referred to in section 15, or part of the survey or re-inspection, is carried out outside Hong Kong by a specified officer sent from Hong Kong, there shall be payable, in addition to the fee prescribed under that section, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for each of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the first 24 hours, or part of it, of the travel period of each officer for the survey or re-inspection or that part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each subsequent period of 24 hours, if any, of that travel period;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the remaining time of that travel period,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount that is, in the opinion of the Director, equivalent to the travelling and subsistence expenses of each officer incurred during that travel period.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Additional fees for surveys or re-inspections outside office hours

subsection.leadIn: If the survey referred to in section 12, 13 or 14, or the re-inspection referred to in section 15, or part of the survey or re-inspection, is carried out (whether within Hong Kong or not) by a specified officer outside office hours, there shall be payable, in addition to the fee prescribed under that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (c), if the day of service is a weekday (other than a Saturday)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for each hour of the service period of each officer for the survey or re-inspection or that part between 6:30 a.m. and 8:30 a.m. or between 5:45 p.m. and 7:45 p.m., a fee of $1,115; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each hour of the service period of each officer for the survey or re-inspection or that part before 6:30 a.m. or after 7:45 p.m., a fee of $2,215;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the day of service is a Saturday or Sunday, for each hour of the service period of each officer for the survey or re-inspection or that part, a fee of $3,270;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the day of service falls on a calendar day that is a general holiday (other than a Saturday or Sunday) in Hong Kong, for each hour of the service period of each officer for the survey or re-inspection or that part, a fee of $3,270.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), where a survey or re-inspection, or part of a survey or re-inspection, is carried out outside Hong Kong, a reference to any time or date in that subsection (except the reference to general holiday in subsection (1)(c)) is the time or date according to the local time in the place where the survey or re-inspection, or that part, is carried out.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the application for the survey or re-inspection was made to the Director at least 3 days before the survey or re-inspection, or part of the survey or re-inspection, is carried out, but the Director has caused the survey or re-inspection or that part to be carried out outside office hours.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Fees for considering declaration of survey and issue of certificates, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid under section 22(6) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a declaration of survey of a Class II vessel, or a Class III vessel, that is a Category B vessel fitted with propulsion engine with total propulsion power not exceeding 30 BHP, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a declaration of survey of any other vessel, $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid under section 59(2) of the Survey Regulation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a declaration of survey, submitted for the purposes of the issue of a survey record of safety equipment or Hong Kong load line certificate, $565;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a declaration of survey, submitted for the purposes of the issue of a freeboard assignment certificate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of a Class II vessel the gross tonnage of which is less than 100, $285;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of any other vessel, $565;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a declaration of survey, submitted for the purposes of the issue of a declaration of fitness, $565.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Fees for issue of new operating licences

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 71 or 72 of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the issue of a new operating licence in respect of a local vessel is a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for each of the following within the validity period of the licence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the monthly period beginning on the first day of the validity period;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each subsequent monthly period,

paragraph.continued: an amount equal to 1/12 of the amount specified in subsection (2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each day within the validity period of the licence that does not fall within a monthly period referred to in paragraph (a)(i), an amount equal to 1/365 of the amount specified in subsection (2).

subsection.content: The amount specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is, for each person by which the number of passengers specified in the certificate of inspection or certificate of survey (as the case may be) in respect of the local vessel concerned exceeds the number of passengers shown in the existing operating licence in respect of the vessel, $165.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Fees for issues of new certificates of inspection and certificates of survey

subsection.content: The fee, under section 72(3) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the issue of a new certificate of inspection in respect of a local vessel is $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 72(3) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the issue of a new certificate of survey in respect of a local vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel that is a Category B vessel fitted with propulsion engine with total propulsion power not exceeding 30 BHP, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $565.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Fees for issues of duplicates of certificates, etc.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 85(4) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of an application for the issue of a duplicate of a certificate of inspection is $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 85(4) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of an application for the issue of a duplicate of a certificate of survey is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel, or a Class III vessel, that is a Category B vessel fitted with propulsion engine with total propulsion power not exceeding 30 BHP, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $565.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 85(4) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of an application for the issue of a duplicate of a survey record of safety equipment or Hong Kong load line certificate is $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 85(4) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of an application for the issue of a duplicate of a freeboard assignment certificate is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel the gross tonnage of which is less than 100, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $565.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 85(4) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of an application for the issue of a duplicate of a declaration of fitness is $565.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Fees for re-issue of certificates, etc.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(iii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the re-issue of a certificate of inspection is $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(iii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the re-issue of a certificate of survey is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel, or a Class III vessel, that is a Category B vessel fitted with propulsion engine with total propulsion power not exceeding 30 BHP, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $565.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(iii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the re-issue of a survey record of safety equipment or Hong Kong load line certificate is $565.

subsection.leadIn: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(iii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the re-issue of a freeboard assignment certificate is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a Class II vessel the gross tonnage of which is less than 100, $285;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vessel, $565.

subsection.content: The fee, under section 76(5)(d)(iii) of the Survey Regulation, to be paid in respect of the re-issue of a declaration of fitness is $565.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Fees Prescribed for Permission and Exemption under Ordinance

section.name: s23
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6

def.name: ChargeableGrossTonnage
def.leadIn: chargeable gross tonnage (須予繳費總噸位), in relation to a local vessel, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one half of the gross tonnage of the vessel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that one half is not a multiple of 100, that one half rounded up to the next multiple of 100;

section.def: specified permission (指明允許) means a written permission of the Director under section 70 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Fees for permission to break up local vessels

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of a specified permission for the purposes of section 41(1) of the Ordinance to break up a local vessel is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is to be broken up within the area of the Victoria port, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: $79 for each 100 of the chargeable gross tonnage of the vessel for each day during which the permission is in force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is to be broken up elsewhere in the waters of Hong Kong, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: $52 for each 100 of the chargeable gross tonnage of the vessel for each day during which the permission is in force.

subsection.def: In this section, Victoria port (維多利亞港口) means the area of the waters of Hong Kong declared under section 56 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) as Victoria port.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Fees for permission to navigate in waters of Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the fee to be paid in respect of a specified permission for the purposes of section 8(1) of the General Regulation for a local vessel of a type described in column 2 of Schedule 4 to navigate in the waters of Hong Kong is, for each of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first monthly period, or part of it, of the period during which the vessel is so permitted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each subsequent monthly period, if any, of the period during which the vessel is so permitted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the remaining time of the period during which the vessel is so permitted,

subsection.continued: the fee specified in column 3 of that Schedule opposite the type of vessel.

subsection.leadIn: If, under the specified permission, the local vessel is permitted to carry more than 14 persons, there shall be payable in respect of the permission, for each of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first monthly period, or part of it, of the period during which the vessel is so permitted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each subsequent monthly period, if any, of the period during which the vessel is so permitted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the remaining time of the period during which the vessel is so permitted,

subsection.continued: an additional fee of $14 for each person in excess of 14 that the vessel is permitted to carry.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Fees for permission to moor to Government mooring buoys

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of a specified permission for the purposes of section 25(1) of the General Regulation for a local vessel to moor to a Government mooring buoy is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the mooring buoy is a Class A buoy, $3,685 for each of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the first day, or part of it, of the period when the buoy is used;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each subsequent day, if any, of that period;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the remaining time of that period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the mooring buoy is a Class B buoy, $2,455 for each of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the first day, or part of it, of the period when the buoy is used;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each subsequent day, if any, of that period;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the remaining time of that period.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (1), day (日) means a period of 24 hours beginning at midnight.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Fees for certain permission of Director
section.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of a specified permission for the purposes of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 53(1) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 4(2) or (4) of the Typhoon Shelters Regulation; or

section.continued: to do, cause or permit to be done, an act prohibited by the provision is $160.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Fees for exemptions under section 69 of Ordinance
section.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of an exemption of the Director under section 69 of the Ordinance is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an exemption from section 28 of the Ordinance, $525;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an exemption from section 3 of the General Regulation, $97;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of any other exemption, $525.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Fees for Services Provided by Director under Section 63A of Ordinance

section.name: s29
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: relevant service (有關服務) means a service performed by the Director, upon request, under section 63A of the Ordinance;

def.name: ServicePeriod
def.leadIn: service period (服務期間), in relation to a service carried out by a specified officer, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the service continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number;

subsection.def: travel period (出差期間), in relation to a service carried out by a specified officer, means the period of time during which the officer is outside Hong Kong on account of the service.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of travel period, a specified officer is outside Hong Kong from the moment when he departs from Hong Kong to the moment when he arrives at Hong Kong.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Fees for Attendance at Legal Proceedings or Inquiries, Giving Advices, Examination of Plans, Search of Records and Issue of Documents

section.name: s30
section.heading: Fees for attendance at legal proceedings or inquiries

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of an attendance of a specified officer in any legal proceedings or inquiries, as a relevant service, is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an attendance within Hong Kong, for each hour of the attendance period of each officer for the attendance, $1,115;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an attendance outside Hong Kong, a fee equal to the aggregate of the following amounts—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the first 24 hours, or part of it, of the travel period of each officer for the attendance;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each subsequent period of 24 hours, if any, of that travel period;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the remaining time of that travel period,

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an amount that is, in the opinion of the Director, equivalent to the travelling and subsistence expenses of each officer incurred during that travel period.

def.name: AttendancePeriod
def.leadIn: In this section, attendance period (出席期間), in relation to an attendance of a specified officer in any legal proceedings or inquiries, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the attendance continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Fees for giving advices and examination of plans

subsection.content: The fee to be paid in respect of a visit by a specified officer to a local vessel that is certificated under the Certification and Licensing Regulation for a particular class and a particular type, as a relevant service, for the purpose of giving advice as to whether or not the vessel is suitable to be certificated for another class or another type, is $365.

The fee to be paid in respect of a visit by a specified officer to a local vessel that is not certificated under the Certification and Licensing Regulation, as a relevant service, for the purpose of giving advice as to whether or not the vessel is suitable to be certificated for a particular class and a particular type, is $365.

The fee to be paid in respect of an examination by a specified officer of plans relating to the structure, machinery or equipment of a local vessel, as a relevant service, for the purpose of giving advice as to whether or not that structure, machinery or equipment complies with the requirement under the Ordinance, is, for each hour of the examination period of a specified officer for the examination, $1,115.

def.name: ExaminationPeriod
def.leadIn: In subsection (3), examination period (審閱期間), in relation to an examination by a specified officer of plans, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of time, in hours, during which the examinations continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that period of time is not a whole number, the period of time rounded up to the next whole number.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Fees for search of records

subsection.content: The fee to be paid in respect of a search by a specified officer of the record relating to a local vessel as contained in the certificate of ownership, full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel of the vessel in the office of the Marine Department, as a relevant service, is $175.

The fee to be paid in respect of a search by a specified officer of any record (other than a record referred to in subsection (1)) in the office of the Marine Department, as a relevant service, is $125.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Fees for copies, etc. of documents

subsection.leadIn: The fee to be paid in respect of the issue by a specified officer, as a relevant service, of a certified true copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of ownership, full licence, temporary licence or permission for a laid-up vessel, is $210;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of inspection, certificate of survey, survey record of safety equipment, Hong Kong load line certificate, freeboard assignment certificate or declaration of fitness, is $565;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document, is $160.

subsection.content: The fee to be paid in respect of the issue by a specified officer of a certified extract of any document, as a relevant service, is $160.
The fee to be paid in respect of the issue by a specified officer of an uncertified copy of any document, as a relevant service, is $9 for each sheet so issued.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Fees for documents to certify that local vessels have been broken up
section.content: The fee to be paid in respect of the issue by a specified officer of any written document to certify that a local vessel has been broken up by the Director, as a relevant service, is $175.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Application of Division 2

subsection.leadIn: This Division applies only to the following services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a visit by a specified officer to a local vessel, shore installation, navigation aid or other site, as a relevant service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reproduction of any drawing of a local vessel by a specified officer, as a relevant service; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the examination of any equipment relating to a local vessel by a specified officer, as a relevant service.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1), this Division does not apply to any service in respect of which a fee is prescribed in Division 1 of this Part.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Fees for services of specified officers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 37, the fee to be paid in respect of a service carried out in whole within Hong Kong by a specified officer is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a service referred to in section 35(1)(a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the first hour of the service period of each officer for the service, $3,270; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each subsequent hour of the service period of each officer for the service, $1,115;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a service referred to in section 35(1)(b) or (c), for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service, $1,115.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 37, the fee to be paid in respect of a service carried out in whole outside Hong Kong by a specified officer sent from Hong Kong is the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service, an amount of $1,115;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for each of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the first 24 hours, or part of it, of the travel period of each officer for the service;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each subsequent period of 24 hours, if any, of that travel period;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the remaining time of that travel period,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an amount that is, in the opinion of the Director, equivalent to the travelling and subsistence expenses of each officer incurred during that travel period.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 37, the fee to be paid in respect of a service carried out in part within Hong Kong by a specified officer, and in part outside Hong Kong by a specified officer sent from Hong Kong, is the aggregate of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the part of the service carried out within Hong Kong, an amount equal to the fee calculated in accordance with subsection (1) as if that part was a service carried out in whole within Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the part of the service carried out outside Hong Kong, an amount equal to the fee calculated in accordance with subsection (2) as if that part was a service carried out in whole outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Additional fees for services outside office hours

subsection.leadIn: If a service, or part of a service, is carried out (whether within Hong Kong or not) by a specified officer outside office hours, there shall be payable, in addition to the fee prescribed under section 36—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (c), if the day of service is a weekday (other than a Saturday)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service or that part between 6:30 a.m. and 8:30 a.m. or between 5:45 p.m. and 7:45 p.m., a fee of $1,115; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service or that part before 6:30 a.m. or after 7:45 p.m., a fee of $2,215;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the day of service is a Saturday or Sunday, for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service or that part, a fee of $3,270;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the day of service falls on a calendar day that is a general holiday (other than a Saturday or Sunday) in Hong Kong, for each hour of the service period of each officer for the service or that part, a fee of $3,270.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), where a service, or part of a service, is carried out outside Hong Kong, a reference to any time or date in that subsection (except the reference to general holiday in subsection (1)(c)) is the time or date according to the local time in the place where the service, or that part, is carried out.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the request for the service was made to the Director at least 3 days before the service, or part of the service, is carried out, but the Director has caused the service or that part to be carried out outside office hours.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8
section.def: In this Part, relevant matter (有關事項) means a matter in respect of which a fee is prescribed under this Regulation.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Fees where services not completed

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the request of any person, any service for a relevant matter is carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in consequence of the act of the person, the service is abandoned before it is completed,

subsection.continued: the Director may reduce the fee payable in respect of the matter under this Regulation.

subsection.content: In exercising the power under subsection (1), the Director shall have regard to the nature and extent of the work involved in the service.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Services required for certain official purposes

subsection.content: The Director may waive the fee to be paid under this Regulation (except section 33(1)) in respect of any service for a relevant matter that is carried out at the request of any public body, or the representative of a government other than the Government of Hong Kong, for official purposes.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may waive the fee to be paid under section 33(1) in respect of the issue of a certified true copy of a document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is issued at the request of the Central People’s Government, or the representative of a government other than the Government of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is required for official purposes.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Waiver of fees
section.leadIn: The Director may waive the fee to be paid under section 28(a) or (b) in respect of the granting of an exemption to a local vessel that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a Class III vessel or a Class IV vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a vessel exempted under section 63 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) from the requirement of section 15 of that Ordinance.

paragraph.name: b
